meanings.definition: Holding to traditional attitudes and values and cautious about change or innovation, typically in relation to politics or religion.
meanings.sent1: She preferred a conservative approach to solving problems, sticking to what had always worked.
meanings.sent2: The company took a conservative stance on adopting new technologies, opting for proven methods.
meanings.sent3: The conservative cat refused to try the new brand of food, insisting on the old one.
meanings.sent4: His conservative views on fashion made him stand out in a sea of bold styles.
meanings.sent5: The conservative town's resistance to change was palpable in every aspect of life.

meanings.definition: A person who is averse to change and holds traditional values.
meanings.sent1: As a conservative, he found comfort in the familiar and resisted any alterations.
meanings.sent2: The conservative was known for upholding age-old customs and beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively until the conservative arrived and disapproved of the music.
meanings.sent4: She was a true conservative, cherishing the past and wary of the future.
meanings.sent5: The conservative's presence brought a sense of stability to the chaotic group.

meanings.definition: A member or supporter of the Conservative Party in the UK or a similar party in other countries.
meanings.sent1: The conservative attended the party meeting to discuss upcoming strategies.
meanings.sent2: Being a conservative, she proudly displayed her party's emblem on her car.
meanings.sent3: The conservative's enthusiasm for the party was infectious, drawing in new members.
meanings.sent4: He wore a pin with the conservative party's logo to show his allegiance.
meanings.sent5: The conservative's dedication to the party was unwavering, even in challenging times.
